meanings.definition: A person who grazes livestock on pasture.
meanings.sent1: The pasturer led the cows to the green pasture.
meanings.sent2: The diligent pasturer ensured the sheep had enough grass to eat.
meanings.sent3: The pasturer joked that the cows were picky eaters, only choosing the best grass.
meanings.sent4: The pasturer was like a shepherd, guiding the animals to the lush fields.
meanings.sent5: The pasturer's job is to care for the animals and make sure they have enough food.

meanings.sent1: Farmers pasturer their cattle in the open fields during the day.
meanings.sent2: The horses pasturer happily in the meadow under the warm sun.
meanings.sent3: The goats pasturered so much that they had little energy left for playing.
meanings.sent4: The sheep pasturered peacefully, unaware of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The rabbits pasturered on the fresh grass, nibbling contentedly.
